segments.text: What's going on?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Kathy died last night.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Oh my God. Oh my God, I'm so sorry.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: yeah, I mean, you know, it was a -
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I guess we saw it coming and she lasted a lot - a lot longer than, uh, they expected but you know, I mean when it actually happens it's just a lot harder.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: It doesn't make any easier, yes.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I mean at least she was home, she wasn't in the hospital anymore,
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Oh, man. I'm so sorry.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: She was with- yeah  She was with Gary, and he said that she was just sitting there and went to sleep, closed her eyes, and that was it.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: It's going to be so rough, I'm sorry.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Yes. I mean, it's not as rough on me as it is on him but
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: God, it's you know, we've spent so much time with them it's just really surreal, really weird that we're not going to be able to see her anymore and go
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Yeah.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: out to- out to dinner you know and do the troops to California, I mean.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Totally.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: It's just that- I don't know, it's sort it's sort- of a weird thing you know
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Yeah
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: not being able to see anyone again, who knows where they really went, you know. I mean, I guess we can just hope that wherever they are now if it's anywhere that it's better I mean.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Yes. Well, at least you have a lot of good memories.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: She was [garbage]
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: She really cared about you, you know.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Yes, I mean she cared about all of us. She was great
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: so loving everybody you know.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: And she was
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Gosh, I just hate I just hate to see her go.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Yeah.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: We were all going take a trip to Europe you know.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Even if you still do she'll- she'll be there.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Yes.  [BREATHING] God.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Are you going to be okay?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I just -- I just don't get it, like there is just nothing you can do about it you know, it's like just out of your control and it
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: just makes it that much harder to deal 'cause as much as you want to, you know, make her better, see her not in any pain, it's like, just I don't know, just has a mind of its own.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Then she's gone.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: It's going to be okay, I promise.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Well, you know I appreciate you coming over and talking to me, I mean it definitely helps
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Sure
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: to talk to somebody but
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: you shouldn't be alone
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: It's just going to take a while, I think.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Yes.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Ah.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Thank you.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Yes.
